avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs have formed after prevailing westerly winds and snowshovers. Snow could transport to southerly aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Some snow has accumulated during SW-snowshowers since the 14th. Little snow in general and mostly some windslabs in gullies and slopes facing N, NE and E. Snow is expected to transport to southerly aspects. No snowpits have been done.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is present in all mountainous areas in Iceland. Wind slabs are likely to be found in most parts and will continue to form in strong N-NE snowstorm over the weekend. Weak layers can still be found in North Iceland but thaw last week has strengthened the snow pack in East Iceland. Whumpfing and cracking has been observed in Tröllaskagi.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow can be found in all parts and wind slabs are present in the mountains. They will continue to form in strong N-NE snowstorm this weekend. Persistent weakness in snowpits in N-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA-átt og él á sugardag. Hvöss norðlæg átt og úrkomulítið á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow. N-gale and snowstorm expected on the 24th with heavy snowdrift.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow in all aspects after snowfall last few days. Little snow was before in the mountains. Rapid windslab formation this weekend due to N-gale and snowstorm.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is present in all mountainous areas in Iceland. Wind slabs are likely to be found in most parts and will continue to form in strong N-NE snowstorm over the weekend. Weak layers can still be found in North Iceland but thaw last week has strengthened the snow pack in East Iceland. Whumpfing and cracking has been observed in Tröllaskagi.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow can be found in all parts and wind slabs are present in the mountains. They will continue to form in strong N-NE snowstorm this weekend. Persistent weakness in snowpits in N-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Vaxandi NA-átt á laugardag með snjókomu og éljum. Gengur í N-storm og hríðarveður á sunnudag. Snýst í NA með kvöldinu og gengur smátt niður fram á mánudag. Búast má við miklum skafrenningi.

avalancheActivity.comment: An avalanche released in Strengsgil the night before 24.12. and ran over the road Fjarðarvegur. Sluffs also released above Ólafsfjarðarvegur. Two avalanches ran over Siglufjarðarvegur late 23.12.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Uncertainty stage due to avalanche danger is in effect in Norðurland. An avalanche released in Strengsgil the night before 24.12. and ran over the road Fjarðarvegur.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow is in the area. It is light and easily transported by wind. Windslabs can have formed in most aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is present in all mountainous areas in Iceland. Wind slabs are likely to be found in most parts and will continue to form in strong N-NE snowstorm over the weekend. Weak layers can still be found in North Iceland but thaw last week has strengthened the snow pack in East Iceland. Whumpfing and cracking has been observed in Tröllaskagi.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow can be found in all parts and wind slabs are present in the mountains. They will continue to form in strong N-NE snowstorm this weekend. Persistent weakness in snowpits in N-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Talsverð snjókoma á aðfangadag og fram á jóladagsmorgun. NA-átt og skafrenningur.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs may be found in places. The snowpack has strengthened after rain and thaw throughout all elevations and subsequent freezing last weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Warming and rain last Wednesday with rain in the mountains and thaw in all elevations. Subsequent freezing has caused the snow pack to stabilize. Since then, there is little new snow but some wind slabs may be found in places higher up.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow is present in all mountainous areas in Iceland. Wind slabs are likely to be found in most parts and will continue to form in strong N-NE snowstorm over the weekend. Weak layers can still be found in North Iceland but thaw last week has strengthened the snow pack in East Iceland. Whumpfing and cracking has been observed in Tröllaskagi.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow can be found in all parts and wind slabs are present in the mountains. They will continue to form in strong N-NE snowstorm this weekend. Persistent weakness in snowpits in N-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Úrkomulítið og vestan 10-14 m/s seinnipartinn á Þorláksmessu. Á sunnudag hvessir með deginum, í norðan 15-20 m/s og éljagangi fram á aðfangadagskvöld.
